title: Medhat Said
text:
Experience
Currently, I am focusing on population pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic modelling of imatinib which is being studied for its repurposing potential in other disease indications including COVID-19 ARDS and PAH.
Previous modelling experiences include:

Development of a novel cardiovascular systems model to quantify drugs effects on the inter-relationship between contractility and other hemodynamic variables using pressure-volume loop theory
Development of a minimal hysiologically based pharmacokinetic (PBPK) model to predict pharmacokinetics and target disposition for recycling and sweeping antibodies
Statistical analysis (LASSO and Elastic net regression) of a high-dimensional set of metabolites in order to discover host-associated biomarkers for identification of pathogens in community-acquired pneumonia (CAP) patients

title: Medhat Said
text:
Teaching
Additionally, I am involved in teaching activities which include supervising students for their research internships, working together with instructors to include PKPD and PKPD modelling in their course curriculum as well as teaching/giving lectures.
Previous teaching experiences include:

BSc Pharmacokinetics & ADME course (2022, 2023)
Msc Pharmacokinetics & ADME course (2022, 2023)
